reviews.review_msg: Good god man this whole class was just propaganda about how meat is awful and vegetarianism is the key to life. He makes you buy HIS OWN TEXTBOOK to study for the exam and has the worst lecture slides you'll probably ever see. Completely disregards the impact of physical activity on health. I thought these reviews were harsh, they really are not
avoid at all costs, worst professor I've encountered, made a very interesting class very boring. very poor lectures. I did well in this class by ignoring his lectures and only using the textbook.

Not as bad as I thought he would be. You really have to pay attention in lectures though because he'll use random things he said in lecture on the tests. The tests weren't too bad, but the quizzes were.
The exams felt fair to me but the quizzes were difficult. I liked mike as a professor and he was entertaining and relatable.

Very disorganized prof, docs don't match his hour long slides at all. Things he says don't match the docs or the slides. it's like 3 lectures combined into one. BPK140 is interesting, but taking it with any other prof would be more beneficial. He also brags about himself a lot, really think he should just retire at this point

First BPK140 is the most underrated course. A course content that should have been mandatory during high school. The truth is many people don't take the time to learn about modern health and managing your wellness. This course provides insights into these topics and will definitively increase your awareness to make better decisions in life.

I was scared prior to taking his course because of his ratings, but he's not that crazy bad except for the fact that he didn't give any lectures. The weekly quizzes were fairly easy but the midterm and the final exam were hard. I didn't use the textbook and still got a B, but if you want an A, you probably should read the textbook.

Mike is not very accessible when it comes to Office Hours and is disorganized. Would not take him again and TA's are hard markers. Marking criteria is also very weird and the curve will mess with your grade.

Worst professor I've had at SFU and I've been there for five years. Completely unprofessional, did not give one lecture (all lectures were pre recorded by other faculty members) thus the only contact I had with him was during the midterm and final exam. The course was extremely disorganized, no clear assignment instructions, unclear deadlines etc.
Mans makes up rules on the spot really does not care about students

Seemed nice, but was very disorganized, usually didnt know the answer to Q's & did little to help. Quizzes weekly, but they all varied from time of day & time limit, so the class did not have much structure. We were not given enough time for the final exam and the last Q was worth HALF (50 marks) of the entire final (no warning of format before).

Very nice prof. Cares a lot about if his students understand. Always available for questions after/before class if needed. There is a small lecture quiz every class tho so be prepared to read, though it is very easy. Midterms were pretty easy with very short essay questions and fill in the blanks. Would 10/10 take again. Lenient marking.

My least favourite prof, exams are fill in the blanks and short answer, questions can be unfair and he isn't helpful. Difficult to talk too. He is passionate about what he teaches, but I would not take a class again with him as it feels like Im just memorizing his notes. he does quizzes in lecture and tutorial, every single one.

great guy, really cares about his students. His exams are really fair and if you read the word doc notes he posts you should do great! the projects are fun and final was very fair as well if you study hard you will do great!
Good professor. Pretty simple if you read the material.

Mike is blunt but highly humorousnice prof.  He provides notes, and only test from them. Unfortunately no one seems to visit him during office hours. (Please do he seems lonely and will welcome you :). I sent in some questions for the midterm he actually used a couple, definitely aced those! Lovely B-sci-elective.

Mike is a great prof. If you show up to class, you will do fine on the midterms. The tutorial isn't for marks, and is somewhat pointless, but the class is extremely interesting and is a great science requirement.

Material ranged from dry- interesting. the tests focused on very specific details like random percentages and memorizing certain words for fill in the blanks. Lots of math errors on tests in terms of marking, always double check your mark.  What kind of prof has a "midterm" on the very last class? thats just cruel. Wouldn't take his class again.

Don't know why Mike has such a bad rating. Straight forward prof, exams are straight from the notes and are very easy to get a good grade in if you put it the time to study. His humour is subtle but enjoyable. Would definitely recommend taking BPK with Mike!  Side note: this is a great class to take if you need a science requirement.

His lectures are very boring and not engaging. Less that half of the students showed up for lectures. I took this class as an easy elective, but turns out his exams are brutal. The TA only marks directly off the answer key, and questions on the exams were very difficult to understand. Overall bad prof, avoid taking classes with him.

This class is really easy if you are an Arts student wanting to take a science class for your requirements. Dr. Walsh is boring, he just reads off his power points you don't even need to go to class. Tutorial is so lame but mandatory. You have a DEBATE and presentations. NO. His tests are so lame too. Avoid him if you can.

One of the best profs at SFU! Never heard anyone complain about any of her courses. Very interactive and the tests are easy. The study material is very organized and one can easily get A's if pay attention in class. Super understanding. I'm still in touch with her 2 years after taking the course. Fav prof. of all time!

Diana is an amazing prof. She is very knowledgeable about the content and is always willing to help her students. Her midterm and final exam were fair and if you study and do the readings, you should do well in her course
pick any other prof

I was so excited to take a course with Dr Bedoya after having read these amazing reviews. She is definitely a great person but man she is just so inaccessible. don't expect any email replies or replies on discussion boards... It feels as though because she did a good job setting up an online course, she said, that's it my job is done and peaced out
she is a very nice professor. explains every concept very clearly.
The final exam was quite heavy. Recommended to take this class if you are good at memorizing.

Loved this prof. She is a great teacher and her lectures/slides are clear with useful study questions. Tests are straight forward as you know exactly what youre studying for. I wish she taught all my classes!

I love Diana and I also love this course. But the tests were garbage. Expects a lot from us, we need to write super detailed in order to get a good mark. TA was kind of rude if you go to her. Need to memorize everything but I'm a English learner it's super hard. Take it if you are good at memorizing. Lectures are fun tho.

She was absolutely amazing. She goes over all the specifics and details so even if you have no science background, you still understand. She's really cheerful, especially for an 8:30 am class. Just all around, a good prof and I would take this class again with her!

I took this course because I needed a science credit, and I'm so glad I did. Diana is my favorite prof, she really cares about her students well being and she is also hilarious. Made 8:30 lectures really enjoyable. She relates material back to her own experiences and explains things really well. Would take every class with her if I could!

Diana is super passionate about what she teaches. I like that she draws experience from her own life to make it more relatable and memorable for her students. She answers questions thoroughly, and really wants her students to succeed. She is inspirational too and her lectures are very interesting!

Diana is a really inspiring professor and you can really tell she cares about the stuff she lectures about. Although you do more work and have to study a bit more than in Peter Reuben's BPK 140 class, it is still a really easy class and a great science credit for people who need one and for people who aren't science majors.
Diana is an awesome prof, it is obvious that she loves teaching. However, she doesn't reply students' email...

Heavy focus on whatever is on her lecture slides and supplementary material from the textbook. Material on lecture slides were not enough to get full marks on exams and had to have explanations from the textbook to get the full mark. If it's a list of things it'll probably on exams. Great prof but not worth the 8:30 class, Just take online

Interesting and knowledgable person and very kind over all but found course too heavily based on pure memorization. No thought needed for anything just answer what she tells you. Tests literally made us list out every point on the slides. But if u got photographic memory, this is the course for u

Diana is hands down my favourite prof so far. She's so caring, inspirational, and motivating with her lectures. The two hours don't aren't boring and dry in comparison to other classes I've taken. I looked up to her all semester and I think she's an amazing person in general. The class content was quite easy to understand too, and exams were fair!
Clear Lecture, Amazing Lecture, Hilarious

DIANA IS WONDERFUL, I TOOK BPK140 WITH HER AND IT WAS REALLY INTERESTING. I WOULD RECOMMEND HER CLASS FOR ANYONE. SHE INSPIRES YOU A LOT AND SHE MAKES HER TEACHING CRYSTAL CLEAR. SHE IS INDEED WONDERFUL. I LOVE HER AND WOULD SURELY WANT TO TAKE A COURSE WITH HER AGAIN.

Diana is a very engaging lecturer and is very friendly! She was always smiling and is definitely a role model. The class was very interesting but you have to really study for the final. The TA was horrible.

She is very knowledgable. Makes lectures enjoyable. However, it's difficult to take what she says in lecture and apply it to exams. She lectures the way we talk on a daily basis, or what we hear in the mediasurroundings everyday. Exams are very tough. TA wasn't helpful, never replied emails.

Found her teaching style super condescending, and the course material relating to social stuff suuuper normative and alienating. Not a tough class for a science credit but if you have any kind of social justice framework or are a queer, etc. you might find this class infuriating.
She is so helpful and great prof. Btw, she is so hotttt!!!

This course is suitable for those who are good at memorizing. There are plenty to memorize. If you're not good at it, Exams are tough DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Yes Diana is a great professor as much as a great marking killer also.
Very good, clear, definitely knowleadgable on what she teaches

Overall a very interesting prof. Shes good at explaining and keeping you interested during lectures. The midterm was fairly easy as long as you study her study questions. The final was pretty hard though, some of the questions were not from her notes or in her study questions. The weekly quizzes were annoying and the TA was very picky.

Stephen Brown constructed the course: The videos were informative and provided the core points in the chapter and really explained quite well and enjoyable to listen and learn. The quizzes and exams I found the most challenging. My downfall in the course. A lot tougher than I hoped this class would be. But very interesting information!

Class was taken with Anne-Kristine Arnold but Stephen Brown created the course and the weekly videos were of him. Very well-organized course. Enjoyed the readings (mandatory, but entertaining - written by him); the assignments were doable; the quizzes/exams were completely fair. Not a heavy workload at all! Took as a B-SCI and loved it.

I didn't specifically have him as my professor for this class online but everything on canvas was by him including short video lecture material. In the short 10-15 minutes of him lecturing, you can thoroughly tell that he is passionate and does not bore you! Found this class very interesting and was not bored when studying. Marking depends on TA

Good prof to have for an online class. Weekly quizzes, 3 quizzes, 1 MT, 1 final all semester long. He explained his topic well in the book he wrote and the weekly videos. Exams were fair, took this as my elective. Solid class.

Tony went through the chapters WAY TOO FAST. There were so many points to be discussed. I understand its my responsibility but theres about 20 long butt chapters to memorize already, if he could just stick to his points and explain with clarity that would help me pass this course. I doubt I will be. Hes a nice guy though
My favourite Prof!! It was a super easy class, all midterms and finals were open note so we could bring anything that was handwritten and it was super interesting! AMAZING PROF loved him!

Peter is great. You can tell he genuinely cares about his students. He is a good lecturer but honestly, you do not need to attend class. I went to 2 tutorials and lots of the lectures and finished with an A. Exams are open-note but you need to make sure you write down everything that's on the slides as his questions are very specific

One of the best profs I had at SFU :) Lectures are chill and he truly cares for his students and wants everyone to do well. Highly respected by students and always willing to interact with them. Fair, funny and and approachable! I would highly recommend his BPK 140 class for anyone regardless of their major.

Peter is charismatic and passionate. He is fair to his students and makes their life easier and less stressful. He really does care! I took his BPK 140 class this winter (2016) and loved it. I recommend this class as it is relevant and interesting. The course material is not difficult. The only downside was tophat sucks and brought my grade down.
Honestly probably my favourite class by far! All of the exams were open book and they were fair. He is a very approachable and caring prof; definitely would love to take another class with him!

Penny is a very organized, mature, and intelligent prof. She speaks eloquently and teaches content well. Exams were at a reasonable difficulty; she is a strict but fair marker. If you put in the effort, you will do well in the course.
Took BPK/KIN 140 with him in Summer 2015, he is a great prof and this course is fun and easy with him.
